question.content: 1.1  Can code and design important parts of an software application using best practices; Failures are not expected.
1.2  Can code and design important parts of an software application using best practices; Failures are not expected.
1.3  He/she is often completing tasks for production environment and code reviewing other pull requests from colleagues
1.4  Can create database architecture and is comfortable in working with any kind of database systems, relational and NoSQL;
1.5  Experience with communication protocols like REST, Queue systems, etc.;
1.6  Worked in teams of more than 3 developers;
1.7  Is able to coordinate small teams
1.8  Is familiar with project management platforms and methodologies like SCRUM and Kanban;
1.9 Good English communication skills in both writing and conversation;
1.10 Has some contact with clients and mainly in writing;
1.11 Has at least 1 certification / certified course in his main area of expertise;
1.12 Has worked with project management methodologies like Waterfall, Agile or Kanban for more than 6 months;
1.13 Developed and held at least 1 internal workshop in his main area of expertise created blog posts/snippets with technological challenges he/she passed through
1.14 Originality or ingenuity;
2.1  Self-learning;
2.2  Find solutions for technical challenges inside project;
2.3  Create the shell at the beginning of projects;
2.4  Code parts of the app that require his expertise that is unique in the team;
2.5  Mentor SDE I and II, helping them in the learning process;
2.6  Offer support for internal trainings and workshops related to his main area of expertise;
2.7  Represent ASSIST in national conferences or workshops as participant and/or speaker or organized Play and Learn session(s).
2.8  Develop a second area of expertise;
2.9  Usually works with minimum supervision;
2.10 Attended to internal competitions and events (Innovative Codecraft, Best Innovative Minds or other), or is involved in Open Allocation projects.
